text.__SUMMARY__:
Iris tenuissima is a species of iris known by the common name longtube iris.
It is endemic to California, where it is a common wildflower in the woodlands and forests of the northern part of the state.
text.Description: This rhizomatous perennial herb produces narrow leaves and an erect inflorescence bearing two iris flowers. The flower has a long tubular throat which may exceed 5 centimeters in length before it opens into white, purple, or reddish-brown streaked tepals.
text.Description-Subspecies:
Iris tenuissima ssp. purdyiformis—affinity to serpentine soil.
Iris tenuissima ssp. tenuissima
